sentences.english: And they ate of them, and adored their gods.
sentences.chinese: 民众吃了供物，且朝拜了她们的神祇。

sentences.english: but on Cain and his offering he did not look with favor.
sentences.chinese: 只是看不中该隐和他的供物。
你们不要再献虚浮的供物。

sentences.english: And as some spake of the temple, how it was adorned with goodly stones and gifts, he said
sentences.chinese: 有人谈论圣殿，是用美石和供物妆饰的。

sentences.english: It is not at all advisable to use items wrapped in plastics during feast-offerings.
sentences.chinese: 在荟供时使用塑料包装的供物是一点都不合宜的。

sentences.english: Fire even came from the presence of the Lord and burned up the sacrifices on the altar.
sentences.chinese: 甚至有火从主面前出来，烧尽祭坛上的供物。

sentences.english: All the people the land shall give this oblation the prince in Israel.
sentences.chinese: 此地的民都要奉上这供物给以色列中的王。

sentences.english: Rather, He knew that Cain's offering was masking an unrighteous attitude.
sentences.chinese: 只是，祂知道该隐的供物隐藏着不义的态度。

sentences.english: Besides the cakes， he shall offer for his offering leavened bread with the sacrifice of thanksgiving of his peace offerings.
sentences.chinese: 要用有酵的饼和为感谢献的平安祭，与供物一同献上。

sentences.english: He is to lay his hand on the head of his offering and slaughter it at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting.
sentences.chinese: 他要按手在供物的头上，宰于会幕门口。

sentences.english: All the people of the land shall give this oblation for the prince in Israel.
sentences.chinese: 此地的民都要奉上这供物给以色列中的王。

sentences.english: He is to lay his hand on the head of his offering and slaughter it in front of the Tent of Meeting.
sentences.chinese: 并要按手在供物头上，宰于会幕前。

definition: tabernacle (biblical word for a meeting hall or tent)
Book of Leviticus/Third Book of Moses
(third person pronoun for a divine being)
